sen.j: 御厨（みくりや）とは、「厨（くりや）」（「台所」の意）の敬語的表現である。
sen.e: Mikuriya is the honorific expression of Kuriya (a kitchen).
Mikuriya is the honorific expression of Kuriya (a kitchen).
Mikuriya is the honorific expression of Kuriya (a kitchen).

sen.j: 中世日本においては天皇家や伊勢神宮など、有力な神社の荘園（神領）を意味しており、後に地名として残った。
sen.e: In medieval Japan, Mikuriya indicated a manor of the Imperial family or dominant shrines, such as Ise-jingu Shrine, (a shrine estate), and this term still remains as geographic names.
In medieval Japan, Mikuriya indicated a manor of the Imperial family or dominant shrines, such as Ise-jingu Shrine, (a shrine estate), and this term still remains in geographic names.
In medieval Japan, Mikuriya indicated a manor of the Imperial family or dominant shrines, such as Ise-jingu Shrine, (a shrine estate), and this term still remains in geographic names.

sen.j: 中世では、たびたび武士団によって略奪される（武士の領地化）といったことが起こっている。
sen.e: In the Medieval period, it often happened that Mikuriya were pillaged by samurai troops (being converted to samurai-owned estates).
In the Medieval period, it often happened that Mikuriya were pillaged by samurai troops (and converted to samurai-owned estates).
In the Medieval period, it often happened that Mikuriya were pillaged by samurai troops (and converted to samurai-owned estates).

sen.j: 歴史上有名な御厨としては、相馬御厨や大庭御厨が挙げられる。
sen.e: Soma Mikuriya and Oba no Mikuriya are famous historically.
Soma Mikuriya and Oba no Mikuriya are famous historically.
Soma Mikuriya and Oba no Mikuriya are famous historically.

tit.e: Geographic names that still remain today
Geographic names that still remain today
Geographic names that still remain today

sen.j: 市町村名に限らず、大字や小字として日本各地に「御厨」の地名が残っている。
sen.e: The term of "Mikuriya" remains as a geographic name in various parts of Japan, not only as the name of cities, towns or villages but also as the name of oaza (a larger section of a village) or koaza (a subsection of a village).

The term "Mikuriya" remains as a geographic name in various parts of Japan, not only in the name of cities, towns, or villages, but also as the name of oaza (a larger section of a village) or koaza (a subsection of a village).

The term "Mikuriya" remains as a geographic name in various parts of Japan, not only in the name of cities, towns, or villages, but also as the name of oaza (a larger section of a village) or koaza (a subsection of a village).

sen.j: 群馬県桐生市や大阪府東大阪市に存在する。
sen.e: Such areas exist in Kiryu City, Gunma Prefecture, and in Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.
Such areas exist in Kiryu City, Gunma Prefecture, and in Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.
Such areas exist in Kiryu City, Gunma Prefecture, and in Higashi-Osaka City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: また、長崎県松浦市には、「御厨駅」という駅もある。
sen.e: In addition, a station named "Mikuriya-eki Station" exists in Matsuura City, Nagasaki Prefecture.
In addition, a station named "Mikuriya-eki Station" exists in Matsuura City, Nagasaki Prefecture.
In addition, a station named "Mikuriya-eki Station" exists in Matsuura City, Nagasaki Prefecture.

sen.j: 地名だけでなく、日本人の苗字にも「御厨（みくりや）」が存在する。
sen.e: "Mikuriya" is also used as a family name.
"Mikuriya" is also used as a family name.
"Mikuriya" is also used as a family name.

sen.j: 著名人では御厨景や御厨さと美や御厨貴などがいる。
sen.e: Kei MIKURIYA, Satomi MIKURIYA and Takashi MIKURIYA are famous examples.
Kei MIKURIYA, Satomi MIKURIYA, and Takashi MIKURIYA are famous examples.
Kei MIKURIYA, Satomi MIKURIYA, and Takashi MIKURIYA are famous examples.

sen.j: 創作作品では武梨えりの原作コミック「かんなぎ (漫画)」や我孫子武丸の原作コミック「探偵になるための893の方法」に御厨仁（偶然にも同姓同名）が登場する。
sen.e: In fiction, Jin MIKURIYA appears in "Kannagi," manga created by Eri TAKENASHI, and (although not being intentional) also in "893 ways of becoming a detective," a comic book by Takemaru ABIKO.
In fiction, Jin MIKURIYA appears in "Kannagi," manga created by Eri TAKENASHI, and (although not being intentional) also in "893 ways of becoming a detective," a comic book by Takemaru ABIKO.

sen.j: 過去には以下のような「御厨」を冠する市町村があった。
sen.e: In the past, there were cities, towns and villages whose names included "Mikuriya" as in the following:
